news_header: Inflation in Finland slowed to 0.7% in December due to falling mortgage rates and electricity prices.
news_text: In December, Finland experienced a slight decrease in inflation to 0.7% from 1.0% in November, attributed to lower mortgage interest rates and electricity prices. Statistics Finland reported that while care charges, cigarette prices, and hospital fees increased, food prices remained stable over the past year. Diesel and petrol prices also saw declines of 7.7% and 7% respectively, while certain items like chocolate and spirits experienced price hikes. Additionally, municipalities raised customer fees, leading to increased healthcare charges.
